questions.question_text: To delete the record with a _key value of smith from the sales collection, a DELETE request should be sent to which REST endpoint?

discussion.content: A and B = correct. _audit and _internal contain logs. fish bucket contains information about where an input is left off in a file and/or which files have been processed. D does not exist.
Could someone help me confirm the correctness of this answer

questions.question_text: Log files related to Splunk REST calls can be found in which indexes? (Select all that apply.)

discussion.content: Look into on my Splunk instance and didn't find anything besides the /etc/system directory. I go with the given answer. Letter D.

comments.content: Fixing my previous answer, the correct answer is C. Agree with @New_user.

discussion.content: Answer is C - $APP_HOME/metadata/local.meta. I've just checked on my SPlunk instance

questions.question_text:
A fellow Splunk administrator is reviewing an app that has been downloaded from splunkbase and deployed in an organization. The admin has e-mailed the following configuration snippet with a brief note that says `fix the permissions`.
In what configuration file should the snippet be placed?
[]
access = read : [ * ], write : [ admin ]
export - system
(Assume that $APP_HOME refers to the path that the app is installed, e.g. $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/<app name>)

discussion.content: Answer is B. You should specify other app's name if script is located there

comments.content:
Sorry, answer is C. Script must be located in the "appserver/static" folder of the app. Since "javascript" is a subfolder, we must specify it's name : script="otherApp:javascript/myScript.js"
Look example here, under "Attributes" header: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Viz/PanelreferenceforSimplifiedXML

C. <dashboard script="myOtherApp:javascript/myJS.js"> 

Same app "/etc/apps/my_app/appserver/static/my_code.js"
<dashboard script="my_code.js">
Other app "/etc/apps/myOtherApp/appserver/static/my_code.js"
<dashboard script="myOtherApp:javascript/myJS.js">

questions.question_text:
Given a dashboard with a Simple XML extension in myApp, what is the XML reference for the file myJS.js located in myOtherApp in the location shown below?
$SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/myOtherApp/appserver/static/javascript/
Which of the following are security best practices for Splunk app development? (Select all that apply.)

choices.C: Manually test application with the controls listed in the OWASP Security Testing Guide.
choices.A: Store passwords in clear text in .conf files.
choices.B: Implement security in software development lifecycle.
choices.D: Use a dynamic scanner such as OWASP ZAP to scan web application components for vulnerabilities.
